original_content:
If you want to get started in microfluidic robotics, [soiboi softs] salamander is probably too complex for a first project. But it is impressive, and we bet youll learn something about making this kind of robot in the video below.
The pneumatic muscles are very impressive. They have eight possible positions using three sources of pressure. This seems like one of those things that would have been nearly impossible to fabricate in a home lab a few decades ago and now seems almost trivial. Well, maybe trivial isnt the right word, but you know what we mean.
The soft robots use layers of microfluidic channels that can be made with a 3D printer. Watching these squishy muscles move in an organic way is fascinating. For right now, the little salamander-like bot has a leash of tubes, but [soiboi] plans to make a self-contained version at some point.
If you want something modular, weve seen Lego-like microfluidic blocks. Or, grab the shrinky dinks.
title: - 初心者向けマイクロ流体ロボットの魅力
body: マイクロ流体ロボットの入門には複雑すぎるサラマンダー。空気圧筋肉が印象的で、3Dプリンターで製作可能。
titles: - 初心者向けマイクロ流体ロボットの魅力
- サラマンダー型ロボットの圧力駆動筋肉の仕組み
- 3Dプリンタで作る柔軟なロボットの新たな可能性
- モジュール式マイクロ流体ブロックの紹介
- 自作サラマンダー型ロボットの制作プロジェクト
